solution_line_template: Each can is filled with {can_capacity}/{quarter_denominator}*{quarter_numerator}=<<{can_capacity}/{quarter_denominator}*{quarter_numerator}={gallons_per_partial_can}>>{gallons_per_partial_can} gallons of water.

A total of {gallons_per_partial_can}*{num_cans_initial}=<<{gallons_per_partial_can}*{num_cans_initial}={total_gallons_initial_fill}>>{total_gallons_initial_fill} gallons of water is filled in 3 hours.
In 1 hour, {total_gallons_initial_fill}/{time_initial_hours}=<<{total_gallons_initial_fill}/{time_initial_hours}={gallons_per_hour}>>{gallons_per_hour} gallons of water is filled.
{num_cans_new} full cans can hold {num_cans_new}*{can_capacity}=<<{num_cans_new}*{can_capacity}={total_gallons_new_fill}>>{total_gallons_new_fill} gallons of water.
It will take {total_gallons_new_fill}/{gallons_per_hour}=<<{total_gallons_new_fill}/{gallons_per_hour}={time_to_fill_new_cans}>>{time_to_fill_new_cans} hours to fill 25 cans to full capacity.
